Title: Ancillary Marketing Desk Analyst II
Description:
General Description: Responsible for analyzing information and creating financial and marketing deliverables for the ancillary coverages of clients. Focus is on dental, vision, life AD&D, disability, and worksite.

Responsibilities:

 Responsible for ancillary financial analytics for clients primarily 300 to 500 lives. Prepare standard analyses. Analyses may include: Market review analysis Rate and contribution analysis Financial, contractual, and rate comparisons and analysis. Manage RFP workload for moderately complex clients. Support senior team members. Help drive USI’s panel carrier strategy and process. Serve as primary contact with insurance carriers on new business quotes and renewals . Includes requesting quotes and evaluating proposals. Develop strategic plans and solutions for less complex clients. Negotiate market results with carriers. With assistance develop alternative strategies, plan modeling, and cost reduction opportunities. With guidance, write client-facing Executive Summaries providing observations, conclusions, and recommendations. Perform technical analysis of group insurance contracts and financial arrangements. Participate in peer review process as a participant and a reviewer. Help mentor less-senior members of the analyst team. May assist with new hire onboarding. Develop and maintain excellent carrier relationships. Keep current on industry information, technology, and trends.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

 2-5 years + experience in Ancillary Employee Benefits related field. High School Graduate. College degree preferred, but not required. Able to work in a fast-paced, team environment with some instruction. Ability to manage and negotiate multiple priorities and deadlines. Must hold or be willing to obtain a Life & Disability license. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills. Working knowledge of Adobe and Microsoft Office products, including Word and Excel. Includes intermediate PivotTable and VLOOKUP knowledge. Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills.

Physical Demands:

Work is performed in a climate-controlled office environment with minimal noise and limited to no exposure to chemicals or toxins. Employees operate office equipment including telephone - headset, computer, computer monitors, keyboard, mouse, copier, scanner, and mail machine. Physical tasks of job include walking, sitting, standing, and bending.

Analysis of Physical Demands:

 Constantly (over 66% of time) work performed requires employees to use repetitive hand motions such as typing, using a keyboard, and sitting at a desk. Frequently (34%-66% of time) work performed requires employees to handle and grasp things, walk on normal surfaces, stand, and bend. Occasionally (1%-33% of time) work performed requires employees to drive to client appointments, have repetitive foot movements, walk on uneven or slippery surfaces to and from work and occasionally reach outward to grab things and bend. Rarely (< than 1 hour per week) work performed requires lifting/carrying items that range from 10-50lbs, pushing/pulling items that range from 10-50lbs, twisting/turning including reaching over shoulder or above head, kneeling or squatting.

  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.
  • Minimum of 10+ years of experience as a Marketing Business Analyst, with a focus on Eloqua and Salesforce.

Title: Lead Marketing Analyst
Description:
SUMMARY:

GEICO’s Marketing Department is seeking a highly motivated and enthusiastic individual to join the Marketing Digital Analytics team. We are looking to hire an experienced Lead Marketing Analyst who will play a key role in informing advertising decisions for GEICO’s brand. Responsibilities include leading analytics projects, producing data-driven insights independently, and developing innovative ideas. You will analyze marketing programs and results, use predictive analytics and machine learning to create value from data, and drive strategic analytics initiatives forward. We celebrate diversity and value new perspectives; applicants of all backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply.

The Sr. Lead Marketing Analyst must be able to transform large datasets from complex systems to produce actionable insights and present the results to stakeholders at all levels within the company. Candidates will need to successfully manage projects and partner with Marketing, Product, Data Science, and other teams.

This role will be involved in several initiatives including customer acquisition cost optimization, media mix modeling, and the development of marketing business intelligence tools. These initiatives will provide enhanced visibility into key business performance metrics to marketing leadership and business stakeholders.

RESPONSIBILITES:

Analyzing the performance of marketing efforts across multiple channels, including but not limited to Television, Search, Social, Email, and Display/Video advertising. Study user behaviors and work with other analysts to join different data sources for measurement & attribution. Assist with managing and improving processes for identity resolution, tagging, and other tracking parameters. A successful candidate should be comfortable working independently and look to find ways to collaborate with other team members. While analytical skills are crucial for the position, it is just as important to have the ability to communicate and summarize complex information into management ready briefs and presentations. 

REQUIREMENTS:

A 4-year college degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Analytics, Data Science, etc.)3-5 years of experience working with marketing analytics tools and data sources. (Web/App measurement tools, cloud environments, and audience management tools)Experience working with Snowflake and LiveRampExperience in querying large datasets. Strong experience with open-source statistical programming tools (Python/R) for analysis and data visualization. Experience with applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc. Experience working in cloud environments. (Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure)Experience with data visualization tools. (Power BI strongly preferred)Familiar with key marketing KPI’s and CRM management. Knowledgeable of current measurement landscape and identity resolution techniques. 

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science or related technical field. Advanced marketing analytics experience working at a brand or agency. Strong familiarity with Marketing KPI’s to manage optimal marketing investment. Experience with the development and usage of in-house attribution and media mix models. Experience with either 3rd party or in-house data pipeline tools to automate pulling marketing data from various platforms and APIs.

You will be part of the in-house Paid Search Team directly managing SEM (Search Engine Management) and Product Listing Ad account strategies and executing day to day tactics to increase revenue, site traffic, and conversion and maximize return on ad spend across one or more of Williams-Sonoma, Inc.’s (WSI) portfolio of Brands.

In the Senior Analyst role, you will be responsible for delivering regular reports, analysis and insights to measure and improve marketing program effectiveness. This role reports to Director or Manager of SEM/PLAs.

 Plan, manage, and execute paid search/ PPC campaigns, including but not limited to account setup, implementation of strategies in tool, campaign structure, budget management, and daily bidding  Plan, manage and execute advanced Shopping campaigns across Google and Bing Product Listing Ads. Deliver weekly and ad hoc search performance reports to Marketing team and Brand partners  Participate in weekly meetings with Marketing partners to review SEM performance, and priorities  Support WSI’s digital testing plan supporting ideation, setup, reporting, and interpretation of large scale text and PLA tests.

 Strong MS Excel skills.  Google AdWords professional (GAP) and other SEM platforms certified a plus  PLA and SEM bid management platform experience a plus  MTA/Incrementality testing experience, good understanding of A/B testing best practices.  Analytics platform experience (Google Analytics/Adobe Analytics)  ETL platform familiarity (Snowflake, Domo, etc.) 


We believe in People First

We firmly believe that working in a culture focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion spurs innovation, creates healthy and high-performing teams, and delivers superior customer experiences. Our DEI initiatives prompt associate participation and engagement, aligning with our core vision to reflect the communities where we do business and put people first.

 A generous discount on all Williams-Sonoma, Inc. brands  A 401(k) plan and other investment opportunities  Paid vacations, holidays, and time off to volunteer  Health benefits, dental and vision insurance, including same-sex domestic partner benefits  Tax-free commuter benefits  A wellness program that supports your physical, financial and emotional health 


Your Journey in Continued Learning


 In-person and online learning opportunities through WSI University  Cross-brand and cross-function career opportunities  Resources for self-development  Advisor (Mentor) program  Career development workshops and learning programs  Speaker series

About Us

Our Company

Founded in 1956, Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is the premier specialty retailer of high-quality products for the kitchen and home in the United States. Our family of brands are Williams Sonoma, Williams Sonoma Home, Pottery Barn, Pottery Barn teen, pottery barn kids, Rejuvenation, Mark & Graham, west elm, or Outward. These brands are among the best known and most respected in the industry. We offer beautifully-designed, stylish and functional products for every area of the home, including the kitchen, living room, bedroom, home office, closet, laundry room and even outdoor spaces. We've seen some big changes since our first brick-and-mortar store opened more than half of a century ago. What hasn't changed is our passion for high-quality products, functional design, outstanding customer service, and enhancing the lives of our customers and the communities where we operate. Today, we're a multi-brand, multi-channel, global enterprise supported by state-of-the-art technology and some of the most talented teams in retailing - and we're always looking for new energy and ideas.

Rivian is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Lead Analyst, Marketing Planning . Responsibilities

 Develop and implement a comprehensive marketing planning strategy aligned with Rivian's overall business objectives . Process complex problems into clear recommendations in memos and PowerPoint presentations for senior leadership  Work closely with marketing, finance, and other departments to ensure alignment and collaboration on planning initiatives.  Utilize advanced analytics tools to analyze marketing performance, customer behavior, and market trends.  Act as a strategic partner, providing insights to drive decision-making across the organization. 

Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Analytics, Marketing, Statistics). Expertise in analytics tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R)  Proficient in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)  Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite ( e.g. Excel, PowerPoint)  Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to convey complex analytics findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.  Self-motivated and execution oriented. Ability to execute at a high level of quality in a fast-paced, ever - changing environment.  Meticulous attention to detail and organizational abilities   Ability to work with ambiguity and build process from the ground up   Excellent written communication skills.  Ability to create compelling presentations and confidently convey insights through storytelling.  Excellent project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple time-sensitive projects under strict deadlines

Description:
About The Company

Albertsons Companies is at the forefront of the revolution in retail. With a fixation on raising the bar with innovation and building belonging through our culture, our team is rallying our company around a unique purpose: to create joy around each table and inspire a healthier tomorrow for every community.

Albertsons Companies is one of the largest food and drug retailers in the United States, with over 2,200 stores in 34 states and the District of Columbia. Our well-known banners include Albertsons, Safeway, Vons, Jewel-Osco, Shaw's, Acme, Tom Thumb, Randalls, United Supermarkets, Pavilions, Star Market, Haggen, Carrs, Kings Food Markets, and Balducci's Food Lovers Market. We support our stores with 22 distribution centers and 19 manufacturing plants.

Placing a premium on adaptability, safety and family well-being, our work model, Presence with a Purpose, offers a hybrid work environment between remote work and office time. A one-size-fits-all approach does not apply to everyone, and teams are empowered to make decisions best for them.

What you will be doing

The marketing team at Albertsons companies has a vision to build lasting customer relationships through personalized experiences that make their grocery shopping effortless and rewarding. We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Analyst, to support development of insights and analytics for our personalized deals program and help us realize our vision. We have several programs that help us achieve that goal today: Personalized deals, gas rewards and grocery rewards.
